jasmine.classification.LogisticRegression

class jasmine.classification.LogisticRegression(use_bias=True, learning_rate=0.01, n_epochs=1000, loss_function=<function binary_cross_entropy>, l1_penalty=0.0, l2_penalty=0.0)[source]
__init__(use_bias=True, learning_rate=0.01, n_epochs=1000, loss_function=<function binary_cross_entropy>, l1_penalty=0.0, l2_penalty=0.0)[source]
init_params(n_features, key=None)[source]

Initialize model parameters.

Parameters:

  • n_features (int) – Number of features in the input data.

  • key (jax.random.PRNGKey, optional) – Random key for parameter initialization.

static forward(params, X)[source]

Forward pass for the logistic regression model.

Parameters:

  • params (dict) – Model parameters

  • X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

loss_fn(params, X, y)[source]

Compute the loss function.

Parameters:

  • params (dict) – Model parameters

  • X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

  • y (jnp.ndarray) – Target labels

Returns:

Computed loss value

Return type:

jnp.ndarray

train(X, y, validation_data=None, early_stopping_patience=None, verbose=1)[source]

Train the logistic regression model.

Parameters:

  • X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

  • y (jnp.ndarray) – Target labels

  • validation_data (tuple, optional) – Tuple of (X_val, y_val) for validation

  • early_stopping_patience (int, optional) – Number of epochs with no improvement to wait before stopping

  • verbose (int) – Verbosity level

Returns:

Final model parameters after training

Return type:

dict

predict_probabilities(X)[source]

Predict probabilities for the input features.

Parameters:

X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

Returns:

Predicted probabilities

Return type:

jnp.ndarray

inference(X, threshold=0.5)[source]

Perform inference on the input features.

Parameters:

X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

Returns:

Predicted class labels

Return type:

jnp.ndarray

evaluate(X, y, metrics_fn=<PjitFunction of <function accuracy_score>>)[source]

Evaluate the model using the specified metrics function.

Parameters:

  • X (jnp.ndarray) – Input features

  • y (jnp.ndarray) – True labels

  • metrics_fn (callable) – Metrics function to compute the score

Returns:

Computed metrics score

Return type:

float
